abstract: Prudential Financial said on Wednesday it expects the sale of its minority stake in Wachovia Securities to produce a $1.5 billion after-tax gain.
snippet: Prudential Financial said on Wednesday it expects the sale of its minority stake in Wachovia Securities to produce a $1.5 billion after-tax gain.
lead_paragraph: Prudential Financial said on Wednesday that it expected the sale of its minority stake in Wachovia Securities to produce a $1.5 billion after-tax gain.

headline.main: Prudential to Bank $1.5 Billion From Wachovia Sale

abstract: Shares in Citigroup plummeted more than 7 percent on Thursday after a stock offering aimed at repaying government bailout money came in under expectations, dragging the bank’s stock lower.
snippet: Shares in Citigroup plummeted more than 7 percent on Thursday after a stock offering aimed at repaying government bailout money came in under expectations, dragging the bank’s stock lower.
lead_paragraph: Shares in Citigroup plummeted more than 7 percent on Thursday after a stock offering aimed at repaying government bailout money came in under expectations, dragging the bank’s stock lower.

headline.main: Citi Shares Sink as Offering Struggles to Finish Line

abstract: At least twice over the past year or so — and especially this week — Citigroup’s best-laid plans have been derailed by Wells Fargo, its scrappier West Coast rival.
snippet: At least twice over the past year or so — and especially this week — Citigroup’s best-laid plans have been derailed by Wells Fargo, its scrappier West Coast rival.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup has traditionally seen Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase as its main rivals, competing fiercely with the other two giant universal banks across a broad spectrum of businesses.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
